sense.name: complete an activity
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] FINISH NP2[patient] Includes: FINISH OFF, FINISH OUT, FINISH UP
sense.examples: They were unable to finish the negotiations. Can you help me finish this crossword puzzle? We are just finishing dessert. Finish the sauce with a dollop of cream. John finished off the chocolate ice cream. The bank finished out all his accounts today. The lawyers finished up their arguments today in court.

sense.name: be a result, be a boundary point
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[topic] FINISH ADVP Includes: FINISH UP
sense.examples: Joe finished fourth in the race. Our meetings always finish on a positive note. Stocks finished higher today after heavy trading. The film finishes with the two brothers heading off on their sail boat. Mary finished up being the valedictorian after nearly flunking out her first year.

sense.name: apply a coat or surface to something, e.g., wood
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] FINISH NP2[patient[concrete]] (PP{P NP[instrument]})
sense.examples: These chairs have been finished with a light varnish. Rub linseed oil into the wood before finishing it.
